LanguageData.WBR.AsexualExplanation: {0_labelShort} is asexual. This means {0_pronoun} will never initiate lovin', which includes asking someone to hook up.\n\n{0_possessive} sex repulsion is {1}. The lower {0_possessive} sex repulsion, the more likely {0_pronoun} is to agree to lovin' when someone else initiates.
LanguageData.WBR.Repulsion08: At {1} {0_pronoun} will never agree to lovin' no matter who asks {0_objective}. {0_pronoun} will only agree to marry another asexual person.
LanguageData.WBR.Repulsion05: At {1} {0_pronoun} will only agree to lovin' with existing partners. {0_pronoun} will have negative thoughts about any lovin'.
LanguageData.WBR.Repulsion04: At {1} {0_pronoun} can agree to lovin' with anyone, but will have slightly negative thoughts about it.
LanguageData.WBR.Repulsion00: At {1} {0_pronoun} can agree to lovin' with anyone, and will have positive thoughts about it.
LanguageData.WBR.Heteroromantic: {0_labelShort} is heteroromantic, which means {0_pronoun} is romantically attracted to people of the opposite gender.
LanguageData.WBR.Homoromantic: {0_labelShort} is homoromantic, which means {0_pronoun} is romantically attracted to people of the same gender.
LanguageData.WBR.Biromantic: {0_labelShort} is biromantic, which means {0_pronoun} is romantically attracted to both men and women.
LanguageData.WBR.Aromantic: {0_labelShort} is aromantic, which means {0_pronoun} is not interested in any romantic engagements.
